comments.commentBody:
Obama's father managed it. Remember the title of one of those inspiring tomes with Obama as the listed author: "Dreams From My Father"?

The legacy of dad's simplistic "Bad America, Bad Israel, Muslim Victims" worldview is all too evident in son's foreign policy.

Tony: What you say makes perfect sense, but have you noticed that our left wing politicians and their followers will tell you that you should take them in? At your expense? That attitude is very prevalent among the liberal commenters here.

And if you refuse, you take the risk of being called names, like xenophobe, bigot, etc.
If the Russians can bring down ISIS, PLEASE let them do it!

"I'm just wondering; isn't Assad better than ISIS?"

Well, he's a lot less likely to cut off your head.
Oh, yes, and the pope is a heretical Catholic (Douthat) and a commie, Bernie Sanders is a Marxist socialist, and Hillary Clinton is dumb.
Polls of the U.S. population say otherwise.

Obama WAS a follower and mentee of Reverend Wright, that great American who performed the Obama's marriage, ministered to him for years, and presided over Obama's tear-soaked born again conversion to Christianity, as described in one of Obama's autohagiographies---maybe even the one with the Wright-coined title, "The Audacity of Hope".

Wright WAS all that, until he was exposed on tape to non-liberals expressing doctrinaire liberal views on America and 9/11 . A man of tremendous personal loyalty, then-candidate Obama delivered a speech the lapdog media termed the Second Gettysburg Address, in which Obama outlined why he could not throw his mentor Wright under the bus. That was about a week before he threw Wright under the bus. Without the tapes, Wright would have been as regular a White House visitor as another great American, Reverend Al Sharpton.
The modern social justice movement does have representation, HAP, in the Democratic Party.   Whether that's unfortunate for the nation and not just America's police officers remains to be seen.

And how do we know those Republicans are "ignorant"? Why, because Obama self-identifies as a Christian, of course!

And how do we know that violent fundamentalists who self-identify as Muslims aren't really Muslims after all?

Why, because President Obama has told us so, of course! Ah, "ignorance" as a function of transactional political exigency....

Judeo-Christian values also dictate that you stone you rebellious child at the town gates and abstain from eating Shrimp (pretty clear cut in Leviticus), or do we pick, choose, and twist for our own personal convenience?
As a New Mexican, tell me about it... Many people I meet when I am out of state, believe Arizona and Texas border each other (despite us being the 5th largest state).

Holly,

You do know Ross Douthat and David Brooks are columnists for this paper, right?

Why is arithmetic so hard for conservatives?
I am sure Exxon Mobil will find a way to reward Governor Sellout down the road. Maybe a nice big fat contribution to a Super PAC ?

.
The Supremes did not release a version of the song, to my knowledge.

Lady Di-ana Ross made it one of her 1st solo singles after breaking from the High Court ....

A DON is behind the hits that are actually carried out by soldiers, or button men, who learn of the orders via buffers. "The family had a lotta buffers." - Testimony of Willie Cicci before a legislative committee, Godfather Part II.

You don't understand that the long term is the accumulation of the short term (look up hysteresis) - and bubbles are mainly the result of a poor distribution of stimulus, not stimulus as such. As for having to understand the REAL reason, it seems you have no faith in the market. The Keynesian position is that if markets freeze up (because of nominal debt/long term contracts/price inertia) you should lubricate them. Your position seems to be not to trust the market to sort things out, but to pull it apart.

"can solve one specific problem"
"The case for fiscal stimulus is quite restrictive"

It's one thing to just say that, but apparently the expression is true: when the only tool in your tool box is a hammer, then every problem looks like a nail. Apparently all problems look like that "one specific problem" and a way is always found to argue that every problem meets that restrictive case.

"Sometimes, however, monetary policy loses its effectiveness, especially when rates are close to zero."

So why is it then that the argument is _always_ that it wasn't enough and more is needed - why is it never admitted that it's lost it's effectiveness?

"It is often possible to drastically shorten this period of pain and greatly reduce the human and financial losses by “printing money”"

In the SHORT TERM ONLY if at all, and then only at the expense of creating the next bubble cycle.

"a hands-off policy toward depressed economies means accepting a long, unnecessary period of pain."

The fallacy is the implicit _assumption_ that there is some alternative that does not exact a greater cost in the end.

"Such episodes can happen for a variety of reasons; the question is how to respond"

But before that question can be answered, the question of WHY that exists in the first place must be answered first. How can an answer for how to respond be given if the REAL reason is not first understood? It's always just _assumed_ without question the reason is one that would "justify" printing money, etc.

I really don't think The Donald needs any ideas -- he's run on a cult of personality so far.  The fact that he's "Brash", "Bold", and 'won't back down" seems to obscure some of the dumb things he says and his schoolyard bully mentality to most of his supporters.  I believe most of his supporters have been "conservative" for a long time, but uninvolved until now in the political process, and appear to be almost totally ignorant of history, economics or politics, the kind of simple folk who think wrestling is real, and still enjoy watching the Miss Universe Pageant.   I think he will continue to be successful with this group until the election, but I don't think it will be nearly enough for him to win even the nomination.

We are now seeing the big ideas of the Obama administration playing out. Refugees fleeing to Europe due to war and instability. Syria aligning with Russia. Iran getting a treaty that will release 150 billion putting their nefarious actions on steroids. ISIS established. Citizens gassed while the line in the sand is erased. China building islands out of sand and calling them part of their country sailing within 12 miles of our coast. Our borders are breached daily by God only knows.   Time for some basic common sense and not thousands of papers by the chattering class.

In the early, heady days of the Iraq war, when sunshine patriotism was abounding, Dick Chaney dismissed concerns about deficits with a wave of his hand, saying Iraqi oil profits would pay for the war.  Wonder what happened to thos oil profits?

But Jeb's are more substantive.  Sure it's the same snake oil of tax cuts for the rich stimulating the economy, but Trump's "plan" seems to be "I'm Donald Trump, and I'll fix this country, elect me and I will figure it out when I'm in office."

Thank you for your thoughtful and considerate suggestions.  There was no cursing or the like but a more neutral position may have helped.  I just feel very strongly about the anatomy of belief systems, especially among religious fundamentelists, and how they can be shoved down other peoples throat.  I did say that Ms. Davis does not seem to understand that the separation of church and state is what insures that she can gather with others to practice a religion openly and freely without fear of prosecution.  Perhaps that was too rude.  There was more but I will leave it at that.

Typical elitist view. In reality, Both Trump and Sanders are riding the populist wave of discontent that started to gain traction in Europe and is now overwhelming the establishment donor class argument that the people are unable to demand better jobs and accountable government.

Putin has moved weapons into Syria not only to gain influence there but also to enhance his position in the world by appearing to be "the good guy" fighting IS terrorists. These actions don't alter the fact that he is a thug and terrorist himself, seizing Crimea and eastern Ukrainian territory, causing a flood of refugees (1 million) fleeing regions of eastern Ukraine.
"Putin is ready to talk" - I wonder why. Is he afraid of taking on IS by himself?
He is not going to shift from his support of Assad. The only encouraging sign is that "Assad is ready for political compromise with the healthy part of the opposition".
The US should never form a coalition with Putin in Syria.

Putin is ready to talk. So, why not engage him? Realistically, the United States cannot prevent Russia from arming Assad. So, what should we do? Supply the "moderate" rebels with tanks and artillery to counter the Russian weapons? There will be no end to the madness in Syria as the Civil War would continue for years. Meanwhile, ISIS will kill thousands more and European Union will fall apart under the burden of migrants. If talking to Putin gives us even a hint of a way out of this, let's do it. If we could talk to Stalin when the circumstances demanded it, talking to Putin should not be such a tall order.
I hope you mean statecraft- not stagecraft.

It makes sense to talk with Putin.  We removed strongmen in Libya and Iraq and what happened?  Those states splintered in factions and ISIL has now captured territory in its quest to establish a caliphate.  We can't make that mistake in Syria even though there's a civil war.  Even though Russia is insisting that Assad stay as a leader, it would be worse if the government completely collapsed.
Chi............you still didn't write why you think President Obama is Weak. I think he's smart. Strong would get us killed. With smart we stay alive.
